name: International Folklorefestival Westerlo
description:
About our festival

Shortly after the foundation back in 1956, folk art group Die Spelewei vzw organized the first local harvest festival. This event was soon getting bigger and it became the Internationaal Folklorefestival of Westerlo. As such, it is one of the oldest folk dance festivals of Belgium.

In front of the late-19th century castle, the festival is organized every year midst August. Five amateur folk art groups from all over the world take part in this festival to show their culture through traditional dances and music.

Participating dancers and musicians stay in host families. The families became very special for the festival because their hospitality is praised by the participating groups over and over again. In return, these families have a wonderful time with their guests during six days. The visiting groups get a unique chance to experience the Flemish way of life. That is why the folklore festival of Westerlo always is an event never to be forgotten by the participating groups and host families.

Internationaal Folklorefestival Westerlo is a member of CIOFF. This memberships can be seen as quality labels for our festival.

For more information, Please check our website.

Folklore Festival (In English): https://festival.diespelewei.be/in-english

Folklore Festival (In Dutch only) https://festival.diespelewei.be/

Group Die Spelewei: https://www.diespelewei.be/

name: VARNA International Folklore Festival
description:
The “Varna Summer” International Folklore Festival was established in 1992 at the initiative of the Varna Municipality. It is held every year during the first week of August. According to the Statute, admitted to participations are youth and adult ensembles from all over the world, as well as groups for authentic folklore.

More than 150 folk ensembles or more than 15 000 participants from 50 countries of Europe, Asia, Africa and America, as well as over 60 amateur and professional folk ensembles from Bulgaria, among them "Pirin" , "Filip Kutev", "Thrace", "Zagore", "Strandzha" and many others have taken part in the festival during its 27-year long history.

The main organizer of the Festival is Varna Municipality, Culture Directorate.

Co-organizers are the Society of Choreographer - Varna and Shumen University – city of Varna.
The motto of the “Varna Summer” International Folklore Festival is FOR THE FRIENDSHIP – TOGETHER TODAY, TO STAY FRIENDS FOREVER. Under this motto every year within several evening concerts participants from the four continents present a splendid dance performance.

Through a combination of video and live performances the audience experiences a colorful journey around the world. The festival has a wide audience of over 15,000 spectators. Besides the evening concerts at the Open-air Theater in the Sea Garden, concerts on outdoor stages in Asparuhovo and Vladislavovo districts are traditionally included in the folk fest program. There are a number of accompanying events such as attractive street processions of the folk groups, creative meeting - discussion with the artistic directors of guest ensembles on issues, related to the folklore art, exhibitions and more.

name: Festival de Confolens - danses et musiques du monde
Balingen International
description:
Seit mehr als 30 Jahren veranstaltet die Volkstanzgruppe Frommern ihr jährlich ihr internationales Volkstanzfestival in Balingen. Hierfür reisen Gruppen aus aller Welt nach Balingen, um ihre Tänze, Musik, Kultur und Traditionen vorzustellen und die Gäste und Zuschauer damit anzustecken.
Über 100 ausländische Tänzer, Tänzerinnen und Musikanten in ihren farbenprächtigen Trachten beleben Jahr für Jahr um den 1. Mai Stadt und Region. Untergebracht sind die Gäste im Haus der Volkskunst in Dürrwangen, betreut und verpflegt von den Mitgliedern der Volkstanzgruppe.
****************************************************************
Since more than 30 years the Volkstanzgruppe Frommern organizes its annual international folk dance festival in Balingen. For this purpose, groups from all over the world travel to Balingen to present their dances, music, culture and traditions to excite the audience with it.
More than 100 dancers and musicians in their colorful costumes enliven the city and region year by year around the 1st of May. The guests are housed in the Haus der Volkskunst in Dürrwangen, hosted by the Volkstanzgruppe Frommern.

name: Internationales Beeke-Festival
description:
For many years now “De Beekscheepers“  have committed themselves to the idea of preserving the traditional costumes, peasant dances and music of the area around Scheeßel.
At numerous national and international folk meetings in Europe, North America and New Zealand they have inspired their public by their program and their natural way of presentation.
The name of this folkloric group originates from the expression “Shepherds by the Beeke”     (a stream which flows trough Scheeßel).  This in lower German being “De Beekscheepers”. At the present time the club has 500 members, divided between the children, youth and adult groups (dancing groups) as well as the folklore orchestra “De Heidjer Dörpsmusikanten” and the singing Group “De Beek-Uln”.
Every two years “De Beekscheepers” organize an international folk festival. One of the main aims of it is to bring young people of many countries together in dance, music and song.
In 1977 “De Beekscheepers” received the European Award for Folk Art in recognition of their work.

name: International CIOFF® Folkore Festival 'Sun and Stone', Nea Karvali
description:
The festivals is organized by the historical cultural association "Stegi Politismou Neas Karvalis", an association created by Greek refugees from Kapadokia region. The festival is a founding member of CIOFF® Greece, took place in Nea Karvali - Kavala.
For more Information, please contact with the private e-mail: info@stegi-karvalis.gr

name: Folk Anacapri & Festival 'del Sud Pontino'
description:
Motivo di orgoglio dell’Associazione Folklorica Minturno è l’organizzazione del Festival Internazionale di Anacapri e del “Festival del Sud Pontino” di Minturno.
Sotto l’ègida del CIOFF® (International Council of Organizations of Folklore Festivals and Folk Arts) si svolge nella prima decade del mese di agosto riscuotendo consensi registrando sempre il tutto esaurito per l’afflusso di spettatori italiani e stranieri.
Il Festival è una festa di suoni e di colori dell’estate anacaprese e minturnese, arricchita con allegria, musiche, balli, canti e costumi provenienti dai cinque continenti. Col fruire del tempo l’evento folklorico internazionale ha assunto il sapore di un rituale che puntualmente e magicamente si ripete con la trepidante attesa e l’entusiasmo di un pubblico sempre più attento e numeroso. 
Il Festival è perciò un'occasione imperdibile di scambio interculturale, in cui il senso di appartenenza e l'amore per le proprie radici, sfociano nell'allegria e nel divertimento come simboli eccellenti di pace. 
“Un cordiale benvenuto a tutti gli spettatori, residenti e turisti con l’augurio che lo spettacolo oltre che piacere possa infondere in ognuno il seme della speranza di pace e fratellanza tra i popoli, poiché solo chi è educato alla pace è in grado di superare facilmente le barriere etniche, linguistiche, culturali, sociali, politiche e religiose che lo separano dagli altri in modo da instaurare un rapporto costruttivo tra le diversità che compongono il mondo intero”.

name: THE FORUM OF THE BALTIC STATES “BALTICA-WEB 2021”
description:
Due to the ongoing pandemic, the international folklore festival “Baltica” cannot be held as usual – as a live event, therefore, the organizers have chosen a different implementation form for it. 
On 20–22 September, in celebration of the Equinox Day and the Baltic Unity Day, there will be held an online or, if the situation allows, semi-online forum “Baltica-Web 2021”, dedicated to a deeper dive into the traditional cultural phenomena, the historical and the cultural interrelations of the three Baltic countries – Lithuania, Latvia and Estonia, which are the organizers of the festival “Baltica”. The forum program will be of two parts – theoretical and artistic, which includes lectures, illustrated presentations, discussions, folklore concerts, music project “Ancestral Weaves” (Lith. “Proteviu audos”), traditional dance event “All “Baltica” dance”, demonstrations of crafts, and traditional ceremonial cuisine, and other interesting activities.
The theme of the forum remains the same as it was assigned to the 2020 festival “Baltica” – the ritual. It will unfold both in the theoretical and in the artistic parts of the programme: by discussing and demonstrating musical (vocal and instrumental) and choreographic folklore, as well as customs, gastronomic and other kinds of heritage, by highlighting archaic and ceremonial forms, by sharing the good safeguarding practices concerning the old traditions. 
Every country is preparing their programme not only following the proposed topics, but also in their mother language in order to show and emphasize the uniqueness and national identity of the Baltic languages, therefore, presentations, lectures and discussions will be simultaneously translated into all three languages.
The events will be broadcast online from the special studios in all three countries. If, the conditions allow, part of the activities will be live.

name: International Folklore Meetings  Lublin
description:
International Folklore Meetings is a folk festival  which was  organized for the first time in 1984. It currently has its 37 edition and takes place under the auspices of CIOFF- International Council of Organizations of Folklore Festivals and Folk Arts. Folk Song and Dance Ensemble Lublin is the organizer of IFM which will take place on July in Lublin , Poland.  
Every year we have invited eight foreign ensembles.  The festival is organized alternately , one year for adult groups, the next year for children’s groups and at present  is the only festival in Poland that has this formula. Every year in the IFM program  there are street parades, performances in Lublin and also folk bands  concerts in the Lublin old town.
The  main goals of IFM are: the protection of national heritage and cultivating  folk tradition; artistic presentation of ensembles from different parts of the world; education in the field of dance and music , mutual learning and exchange of experiences and establishing friendly contacts and bonds between festival participants.

The Festival has been recognized as a CIOFF® International Festival

name: Beskidy Highlanders Week of Culture, Bielsko-Biala
description:
Every year on the occasion of Beskidy Highlanders’ Week of Culture, several thousand performers from almost one hundred folk groups are watched by an audience of a few thousand people. This huge event is always organised in the middle of the summer. During nine days folklore lovers can participate in outdoor concerts of regional Polish and foreign groups in five towns (Wisla, Szczyrk, Zywiec, Maków Podhalanski, Oswiecim). Additionally, there are going to be organised local folk events in four other locations (Ujsoly, Jablonków, Istebna, Bielsko-Biala) and processions in order to attract people and encourage them to come to amphitheatres – colourful costumes, joyous folk songs, and even dance performances seduce inhabitants and tourists. The atmosphere is always unique. One of the most important events organised since 1970 during the Beskidy Highlanders’ Week of Culture is the Festival of Polish Highlanders’ Folklore competition, which presents the beauty and variety of the Polish highlanders’ culture. It is particularly exciting for the participants. Every group wants to win the first prize, which is the Zywiec Gold Heart. The exotic and the unknown are usually the most interesting for the viewers. Therefore the foreign groups are the attraction too. They appear on all the festival stages, but they mainly participate in International Folk Meetings. It has been organised since 1990, alternately in Wisla and Zywiec. The performers are appraised by the International Art Council, which is composed of distinguished specialists, ethnomusicologists, and ethnographers. One person is not able to see and experience everything, but it is the best idea to choose one place and be there for a couple of evenings in a row. The tickets are not necessary because the shows are free. On some occasions, it is worth coming a little bit earlier in order to find a good seat. Before the concerts start, the whole audience sings the unofficial anthem of the Beskidy highlanders “Szumi jawor”, which was written by Adam Niedoba. We cordially invite you to our festival!

The Festival has been recognized as a CIOFF® Recognized International Festival.

location: Regional Center for Arts in Bielsko Biala

name: 'Figulinas' Festival - Florinas
description:
FIGULINAS FESTIVAL
L’Associazione ripropone ogni anno, dal 1989, l’importante appuntamento con la Manifestazione denominate “Rassegna Internazionale del Folklore Lorenzo Manconi”, rassegna di canti e balli tradizionali, anche denominata FIGULINAS FESTIVAL.
Con questa manifestazioni si intende continuare a valorizzare e divulgare le antiche tradizioni di canto e di ballo della cultura popolare isolana, di favorire l'interscambio culturale con le altre realtà dell' Europa del bacino del mediterraneo e del resto del Mondo.
Tutto ciò è assicurato dall’impegno e dalla passione dei ragazzi e delle ragazze che fanno parte dell’Associazione, i quali, dedicandosi efficacemente, riescono, in modo eccellente, a dare il meglio di se stessi rendendo così possibile un importante e straordinario fenomeno di aggregazione sociale.
La manifestazione negli anni ha acquisito sempre maggiore importanza, tanto che dal 2005 è stata inserita nel circuito del CIOFF® (Conseil International des Organisations de Festivals de Folklore et d’Arts Traditionells) Partner Ufficiale dell’UNESCO che si occupa dell’Organizzazione e della salvaguardia di più di 300 Festival in circa 100 paesi di tutto il mondo.

name: FESTIMAIORCA -  FESTIVAL INTERNACIONAL DE FOLCLORE DE MAIORCA
description:
The first edition of our festival was in 1975, being at the time exclusively with Portuguese national groups.

In 1982, a group from Galiza – Spain, opened the door to the international festival that we know today.

In 1991, the International Festival of Folklore of Maiorca, got a new name: FESTIMAIORCA, and since 2002 has come to occupy a prominent place on the international folklore festival’s calendar that take place in Portugal, under the symbol of C.I.O.F.F. – International Council of Organizations of Folklore Festival and Folk Arts.
CIOFF® is a Non-Governmental Organization informal consultative relation with UNESCO.

Throughout the various editions had passed the stage of the “Palace Square” (Terreiro do Paço) groups from various countries from around the world: Spain, France, Italy, Belgium, Holland, Germany, Greece, Turkey, Serbia, Sweden, Russia, Georgia, Ukraine, Lithuania, Hungary, Romania, Bulgaria, Mexico, Argentina, Israel, Togo, Sierra Leone, Timor, Czech Republic, Slovakia, and the various regions of the country, including the Azores and Madeira.

The festival’s program has had some changes over the years. Initially the festival was confined to a single day. In 1991, now has two days of initiatives, with the introduction of the Dance of Friendship (Baile da Amizade). In 2002 the festival embraces the costume that you know today: six days of initiatives, from the welcome party of Dance of Friendship on Friday night, passing to Portuguese traditional games, the International Mass at the Mother Church of Maiorca on Sunday, with the participation of international groups.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/festimaiorca/
location: 'FestiMaiorca' Festival Internacional de Folclore de Maiorca

name: FESTIVAL DE FOLCLORE INTERNACIONAL ALTO MINHO
description:
The Festival de Folclore Internacional – Alto Minho is a symbol of understanding and conviviality. 
This week long International Folklore Festival, always taking place in early September, includes Grand Galas in the most ancient parlour of the most northern Atlantic city in Portugal - Viana do Castelo – but also performances at several social and cultural institutions, an initiative that shows the Festival’s solidarity towards those who cannot attend the evening events.
The Festival has always offered an ambitious and diversified programme that strengthens cultural miscegenation, simultaneously contributing for the promotion of traditional culture and helping to distinguish Viana do Castelo as Capital of Portuguese Folklore.

Oficial Website: http://vianafestas.com/pt/eventos-e-romarias/xviii-festival-de-folclore-internacional-alto-minho

name: International Folklore Festival 'Floare de pe Baragan'
description:
International Folklore Festival ''Baragan’s Flower''
The International Folklore Festival “Baragan`s Flower” is being organized by The County Center For Conservation and Promotion of Traditional Culture Ialomita. 
The festival is being held each summer in Slobozia and some other towns of Ialomita, during 4 days. To participate you need an official invitation from the organizers, received after being chosen from all the offers of the various folk ensembles and groups throughout the world. 
Trough song, dance and folk art, the festival promotes each nation's beauty and uniqueness, in context of globalization and keeping the social and cultural identity. Cultural exchanges have and will be contributing to human knowledge, strengthening friendships and enriching the cultural horizon of the participants. 
This event represents a true celebration of folk song and dance, showing off the originality and traditions of so many generations and transmitted trough the art of performing. During the festival, the participants get to visit Ialomita district with its towns and attractions and also with the well known hospitality of its inhabitants. 
The International Folklore Festival “Baragan's flower” represents a time of meetings and spiritual exchanges between different nations, traditions and cultures, in the name of friendship and peace. 
Organizers will receive the groups in Slobozia town on the day before the official opening of the festival, in the evening. Departure from Slobozia will take place in the first day after the official closing the festival, in the morning. 
The Festival Administration will provide full accommodation (including 3 meals daily) and fuel for local transportation (just in Ialomita county, only for performances or festival’s activities) during the festival to all participating groups.
Only adult members of the groups accepted (over 16 years). Each group will pay for their transportation to Slobozia town and back. The ensembles shall secure their insurance in their own account in case of illness or accident (health and travel insurance).
Publicity materials and information kit highlighting the group history and activities with photographs and any performance to be published will be sent one month before the beginning of the Festival. 
The organizers of the festival reserve the right to draw up a video and audio records and photographs of all participants during the festival and to use this material further without any constraints for the purpose of archiving and promotion of the festival.
The groups will perform artistic programs on: 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, and 1 hour with live music (no playback).

name: RFI - Rencontres de folklore internationales de Fribourg
description: The International Folklore Festival of Fribourg (RFI) is located in the city of Fribourg, Switzerland. Fribourg is a charming medieval town of about 40’000 inhabitants, located at the boarder of French- and German-speaking Switzerland. The RFI was founded in 1973 by three folklore enthusiasts Cyrill Renz, Pierre Stempfel and Albert Bugnon, and took place every year since then. The aim of the RFI is to preserve traditional art by giving a platform to express oneself through traditional dance and music and to share one’s culture. With an attendance of over 30’000 (600 to 2’500 per show), the RFI has become one of the most important cultural event of the region. A member of the International Council of Organizations of Folklore Festivals and Folk Arts (CIOFF), the RFI is recognized internationally in the folklore scene. The festival hosts each year from 8 to 10 international traditional dance groups and takes place over 8 days during the month of August.

name: International Folklore Festival 'Sarajevo'
description:
YEARS OF DANCE AND FRIENDSHIP

We have set off on the cheerful road of folkloric joy in 1998 with the full understanding and support from Sarajevo Canton; City of Sarajevo, Old Town, Center, New Sarajevo and New Town municipalities; Federal Ministry of education, science, culture and sport.

In the following years we had excellent issues of the Festival, with guest performers from: Albania, Egypt, Croatia, Macedonia, Sweden, Phillipins, Georgia, Italy, Hungary, Slovenia, Montenegro, Czech, France, Turkey, Poland, Spain, Germany, Senegal, U.S.A., Greece, Austria, Mexico, India, Russia, Slovakia, Northern Cyprus, Malaysia and of course, many groups from BiH, including all folklore groups from Sarajevo. 

In all the previous years the Festival kept up a tradition of having ten(ish) groups a year, out of which 5 or 6 from abroad. That adds up to about 2700 guest performers from around 30 countries of Europe, Asia, Africa and America in more than 160 concerts, defiles and promenades through the streets and squares of Sarajevo City and Sarajevo Canton. All in all, more than 5300 domestic and foreign dancers and musicians presented the beauty and wealth of their dances to the citizens of Sarajevo, our guests and tourists. 

Halid Kuburovic, Director

name: Festival International 'Polesian summer with Folklore'
description:
Participating conditions:
1.The festival takes place in Lutsk beautiful town in the West part of Ukraine.
2.Folk groups with orchestras take part in the festival. The number of participants is 25. 
3.The age of participants must be from 16 years old.
4.The groups will be accommodated in Hotel “Svityaz” located in the center of the town. The rooms in the hotel are with 2, 3 or 4 beds. 
5.The organizer has right to change the program for some reason, but have duty to inform the groups for any changes in due time. 
6.The programme of the Festival includes: Indoor and outdoor concerts; Parades; Holy mess; Traditional trade; national meals, Parties of friendship.
7.The festival is not of a competitive character.
8.The participants of the festival are the defined by the National Section CIOFF and the organizing committee of the festival folk groups, which represent the authentic, elaborated or stylized folklore of their countries.
9.Every group must prepare the concert program of the duration: 2x30 min; 30 min. – for the outdoor concerts; 10 min. – for the opening ceremony; 10 min. - for the closing ceremony; 4-5 min. – for the parade; 2 x1 5 min. – for the indoor concerts.
10.During the Festival the groups must participate in all the Festival events.
11.The Festival provides accommodation, meals, first medical aid, local transport services. The Festival is not responsible for any kind of broking up of the group’s own transport.
12.The getting of the Visas are on the side of the group. If any problems appear, you should contact the Festival.
13.The group must provide the medical insurance by itself.
14.Shopping and Sightseen will be on free time of Folk Festival 
15.The group must bring two national flags.
16.We have 2 airports in Ukraine: in town Lviv (150km) from our town Lutsk; in town Kiev -the capital of our country (400km) from our town Lutsk. You can choose by yourself, which airport is better for you. We offer transportation to and from airport and also during the festival for all groups. 
17.All groups will have an English, French, Spanish and German- speaking guides.
18.The festival committee doesn't pay any pocket money for groups.
19.The necessary attribute of the festival is the perform of ecclesiastical song (may be with the accompanied of the orchestra) during the holy-mess in Churches (Orthodox and Catholic).
20.The confirmation of your participation is a participation card.
21.The group must also send promotive materials, 2 colour photos, videotape.

name: International Student Folk Festival
description:
Invariably, the University of Silesia has been the main organiser of the International Student Folk Festival (MSFF) for more than 40 years, while the Student Song and Dance Ensemble “Katowice” serves as its host. We are one of the two folk festivals in Poland prepared by students with the assistance of the academic community. During the 32 editions of MSFF, we enjoyed the performances of more than 300 ensembles coming from nearby countries – among others, Germany, the Czech Republic, Hungary, Italy, Spain, Portugal, Macedonia, Greece, Cyprus, Türkiye, and from afar – e.g. Columbia, Mexico, Indonesia, Malaysia, Kenya, and Benin. Nowadays, more than 400 performers who are completely in love with folklore come to Cieszyn each year. Showcasing the extraordinary variety of songs, dances, and folk costumes is the best way to promote traditional culture, both Polish and from other regions of the world. We share our knowledge of folklore with the audience also through lectures and workshops. In times of widespread globalisation, nurturing and maintaining folk traditions is not the easiest thing to do, but as the MSFF we do our best to keep proving to you the beauty of folklore. Each year during the festival the whole Cieszyn comes to life – concerts and other open-air events take place in the urban space, and colourful parades of artists from all over the world travel through the city streets. Cieszyn Silesia becomes a centre of interest for folklore aficionados, but the festival is also very popular with tourists and people from nearby towns.

The Festival has been recognized as a CIOFF® International Festival

address: 1110 North Old World Third Street, Suite 420
name: Holiday Folk Fair International
description:
The Holiday Folk Fair is an annual five-day festival celebrating cultures from around the world. Thousands of visitors attend the Fair each year. It is held the weekend before Thanksgiving in West Allis, Wisconsin, at the Wisconsin Exposition Center of Wisconsin State Fair Park. It is billed as the largest indoor multicultural festival in America. The Fair's goal is to encourage peace through respect and intercultural understanding.
Folk Fair offers continuous entertainment, food from around the world, exhibits, market and demonstrations. A visitor can find egg rolls, strudel, scones, falafel, pizzelle, and sushi all under one roof. The main entertainment takes place on two floors, the All Nations Theater and the Music Pavilion. Youth perform on the International Stage. The Coffee House offers music and song.   Dancers representing over 30 ethnic groups perform for the crowds.

name: Festival of the Children of Mountains, Nowy Sacz
description:
International Festival of Children’s Folk Ensembles FESTIVAL OF THE CHILDREN OF MOUNTAINS is organized in Nowy Sacz since 1992 by SOKOL Malopolska Culture Centre. The main principle of the Festival is to teach through play, and so the Festival is not competitive. The ensembles’ programmes should be adjusted to the child’s age and interpretive skills, and their foundations should be children’s games and play characteristic of a given region. The Festival participants: Polish and foreign ensembles (up to 14 years) are paired up to form comrade couples who perform together at concerts and during attendant events. This allows the children to get to know each other better during everyday Festival life and to forge closer rapport. Each comrade couple has its “national day.” On that day during the main concert the ensembles initiate shared fun with the audience, as well as they have an opportunity to present the culture of their own country and region in various forms of off-stage activity (national cuisine, exhibitions, fairs). During the final concert all the ensembles perform a joint stage programme following one specific idea. Such a concert formula makes it possible to make the children realise that cultural differences are no barrier to the achievement of common goals and creation of new values. During the Festival week there is also a number of attendant events, providing the participants with the possibility of relaxation and fun, as well as allowing the children to see the beauty of southern Poland. The Artistic Committee is in session during the Festival. In meetings with ensemble leaders it evaluates the programmes and stage performance. 

The Festival has been recognized as a CIOFF® Recognized International Festival.

name: PYESTA KOLON DATAL
description: Pyesta Kolon Datal is an international folklore festival celebrating our pride for our indigenous culture that defines us as a distinct group of people yet so connected with the rest of the world through our songs and dances, our artistry and our love for the arts as our way of expressing our own beliefs, traditions and set of values. It is a week of merry-making through street dancing and other dance performances and exchanges that do not only aim to entertain but, most importantly, endeavour to share what we have as a  people and as a country.

name: International Folklore Festival 'Folklore without boundaries', Ostrava
description:
The festival of city folklore groups with international attendance

The festival usually takes place in the second or third week of August but in the year 2015, is set to dates from 17th to 21st of August.
The festival is listed in the official calendar of festivals and feasts supported by the Czech Folklore Association since 1998, what happened after highly acclaimed preliminary year.
Festival is also an affiliate of the Czech section of the CIOFF organization and is classified in the National section of I.O.V. The organizers are trying to assemble the program out of five international groups, one Bohemian and one South-Moravian group (regions of Czech Republic) and presented are also local ensembles from Ostrava. On average, there are 12 groups participating each year.

Four main afternoon shows are realized in Ostrava municipals, in the Ostrava disctricts Moravska Ostrava & Privoz, Marianske Hory, Ostrava Jih and Ostrava Poruba. These concerts are taking place at mobile platforms in dense built-up areas or near to shopping malls, and start at 4.30 PM regularly. They are usually opened by the procession of the groups what is ment as the invitation to the shows.
The accompanying program called “Dancing city” is a set of small morning performances of the attending groups at various institutions of the city of Ostrava (e.g. retirement’s homes, different public places)
The opening concert is usually organized in the hall of Ostrava’s Jacacek Conservatory & Gymnasium, the closing show at Silesian-Ostrava castle. Events are supported by the dance workshops.

Every year, there is realised an exposition of photographs from the past festival years at the foyeur of Ostrava Town Hall. The organizers also enriched the 10th jubilee year in the 2007 by the anniversary concert with extending presentation of traditional crafts at the Silesian-Ostrava Castle.
As the years go by, there is also prepared wide variety of activities for the attending groups as the excursions to some of the local breweries, Mining museum or the performances at the Klimkovice Spa.
The patronage of the festival is taken by the Mayor of Ostrava and also some other local cultural, political or civil celebrity every year. Traditional is also the audience at the Town Hall with the presence of the Mayor of Ostrava.

The medial partners of the festival are Czech Television - studio Ostrava, Czech Radio Ostrava, regional press representative and the magazine Program.

name: Kalenat International Children Folklore Festival, Lappeenranta
description: Lasten Kalenat is a cultural festival with a main focus on children.  The festival gives an opportunity for different groups of children to perform in theatre, dance and circus. The festival program offers a variety of performances by different childgroups but also interesting performance art workshops. The festival culminates in a main show in a celebration of performing arts linking together over 700 young theatre, dance and circus makers.

name: Yilan Intern. Children's Folklore & Folkgame Festival (YICFFF)
description:
The Yi-lan International Children's Folklore & Folkgame Festival (YICFFF) is
- an annual festival, taking place in July and August in Dong-shan River Chin-shuei Park, Yilan, north- east part of Taiwan, whose four main themes are performance, exhibition, games and exchange.
- a happy festival with four major themes, performance, games, exhibition and exchange in which different programs and facilities are available for people, especially the family to enjoy a happy summer.
- a festival for cultural exchange in which folk groups from different parts of the world get together to make performance for the public, showing and promoting the folk art and culture of their countries, learn from each other, get to know different culture and make friends on earth through different activities, arranged by the festival organization such as Group's Night, Home Dish of each county, Country Day...etc and experience the culture and life of Taiwan while the local people can know more about the world without the need to go abroad.
- a qualified international festival, which is recognized as CIOFF® International Festival by CIOFF® on 11 November 2010.

Till 2023, this event has had 399 international participating groups from 98 countries on earth and attracted more than 10,000,000 visitors since its establishment in 1996.

For more information, please refer to http://www.yicfff.tw or http://www.facebook.com/YICFFF
location: Cultural Affairs Burreau, Yilan County Government

address: Novohradské osvetové stredisko  Kármánova c. 2, 98401 Lucenec, Slovensko
name: International Folklore festival in Novohrad
description:
The usual term of the proceedings our festival „The International Novohrad Folklore Festival“  / Medzinárodný novohradský folklórny festival  (MNFF) is the end of July in two countries - Slovakia and Hungary.

The aim of the International Novohrad Folklore Festival is to revive  folk traditions of regional  culture as well as to mediate an authentic experience of various forms of folklore from abroad.

     The history of the festival started in 1995 when the County Tourist and Cultural Centre in Šalgotarján / Hungary/ decided to unite several smaller folklore events into unique one. In the year 2000, the moving festival crossed the frontier between Hungary and the Slovak Republic and territorially gained dimension of cultural and historical Novohrad. The Novohrad Cultural Centre in Lucenec (Novohradské osvetové stredisko) became the main organizer on the Slovak side.

     The festival makes possible to meet people, links them with common experiences and develops good mutual relationships.
location: Different villages at the borders of Slovakia and Hungary

name: International Folklore Vistula Festival, Plock
description:
Vistula Folk Festival is held annually in August. Five foreign and two Polish bands participate in the festival. The program of the festival includes stage concerts, a folk concert as well as activities of direct contact with the audience, games with children, presentations of the culture of a selected nation, parades. Festival participants live in one place, thanks to which integration meetings and spontaneous games are possible every evening. Festival participants take part in the holy mass where they present their own religious song. We offer very good conditions for stage technology.

The Festival has been recognized as a CIOFF® International Festival

name: Rassegna Internazionale del Folklore 'Moles Aeterna' - Moliterno
description:
Moliterno is a 5000-inhabitant town in Basilicata, situated about 200Km south of Naples. It offers a cultural space firmly rooted in its folklore, kept alive by the local high schools and the many youth associations. One of these associations is the “U Cirnucchiu” folk group, which was established in 1966 with the goal of salvaging and valuing the rich, local cultural heritage. Since 1995 the group has organized various cultural exchanges and hosted the “Moles Aeterna” International Folklore Festival, named after the local crenellated tower built by the Lombards (according to many scholars, the town itself was named after this tower). The “Moles Aeterna” Festival is the only one in Basilicata recognized by CIOFF It features at least five folk groups from abroad – both from Europe and from overseas – as well as several Italian groups. The performances of these groups always attract a large audience, even from nearby regions.
TRADITIONS - WORKSHOPS
Traditional games. During the workshops we will explain traditional folk games, a cultural asset we value and want to protect.
FOOD DELIGHTS
The “Canestrato di Moliterno” cheese festival revolves around the rich local culinary heritage, with its simple and natural flavours that are reminiscent of traditions dating back thousand of years. “Canestrato di Moliterno” is a fine sheep cheese that received the European PGI status for its quality and the specific ripening process.

name: World Folk Review Integration
description:
The World Folk Review INTEGRATION is an international festival organized since 2001 in Poznan in August. For 22 years, the festival has been visited annually by groups from all over the world and Poland, this giving the inhabitants of Wielkopolska the opportunity to learn about other cultures. Since 2001, INTEGRATIONS hosted 114 teams from 41 countries. The general concept of the festival is the assumption that folklore is a permanent element of our identity, and the organizers focus on direct contact with the audience. Therefore, in addition, the festival program includes dance workshops, national evenings and the International Tournament of Traditional Sports "Pierscieniówka". The events are available to all viewers, of all ages, which allows for direct experience of the proposed aspects of folklore. The folk groups invited by the organizers not only give concerts, but also integrate. We fill their free time by offering visits to tourist attractions in the area: showing the history and traditions of the region in the visited cities. The culminating point of the Festival is the final concert, organized each time against the backdrop of a different, unique and exceptional place in Wielkopolska region. This concert is unique. It combines the play of lights and sounds - the most interesting elements selected from the programs presented by the groups during the festival. Therefor, the  World Folk Review INTEGRATION has been in the forefront of the best-rated festivals organized under the patronage of CIOFF in the world for a long time.

The Festival has been recognized as a CIOFF® International Festival

name: Festival Internacional de Folklor de Hidalgo
description:
Festival con una trayectoria de mas de 22 años, en donde los espectadores pueden disfrutar de música, folklor y artesanías a lo largo de 5 días.

Durante 21 años hemos tenido presencia de grupos internacionales y en Octubre del 2019 pudimos contar con la presencia de dos grupos nacionales.

El Festival tiene varias sedes, la principal es Tulancingo de Bravo donde se originó, sin embargo, la idea de que el nombre lleve Hidalgo es que los grupos internacionales conozcan un poco más de los pueblos y ciudades que conforman al estado, e indagar en sus costumbres y tradiciones.

Nuestro público es de todas las edades, tenemos un día en especial en donde los grupos que vienen hacen una función para las escuelas de Tulancingo, gracias a esta iniciativa hemos podido contar cada año con más escuelas interesadas, y así compartir y conocer un poco más de la cultura y tradición de los diferentes países y estados.

name: Spectacles du monde - Port-sur-Saône
description:
Le Festival International de Folklore de Port-sur-Saône est né en 1990, sur une idée des élus de la ville et de son Maire Jean-Paul Mariot, très attaché aux valeurs de tolérance et de fraternité entre les peuples.

C'est le groupe roumain NEDEIA de NOVACI qui a été le premier à « ouvrir le bal »... dans le gymnase de la ville sur une scène en bois devant 100 spectateurs !

Devant l'engouement des débuts, la formule a rapidement évoluée, vers un mini-festival en 1996, avec la participation de six pays sur trois jours.

En 1999, le Festival pris son rythme de croisière avec la présence de neuf ensembles folkloriques sur six jours.

Au fil des années, le festival a acquis une grande notoriété qui dépasse aujourd'hui largement le cadre régional avec près de 35 000 festivaliers venant essentiellement de l'Est de la France.

Ce succès, on le doit à la présence indéfectible de plus de 150 bénévoles qui s'impliquent depuis de nombreuses années dans l'organisation générale et à tous les niveaux : accueil des groupes, restauration, spectacles, buvettes, activités sportives et culturelles...

Fidèle à des valeurs de tolérances, de partage, d'amitié et de paix entre les peuples, le festival est devenu un véritable carrefour des peuples qui permet la découverte des cultures du monde.

Une découverte accessible au plus grand nombre puisque depuis 2012, les organisateurs ont engagé un pari audacieux : l'accès gratuit à tous les spectacles !

Depuis 2014, le Festival se délocalise avec l'organisation de nombreux spectacles sur le territoire de la nouvelle Communauté de Communes Terres de Saône qui regroupe 38 communes.

Du 02 au 07 août 2022, la fête battra son plein sur le village du Festival près de la salle Saônexpo à Port-sur-Saône !

Dix jours de partages et d'échanges entre les 400 artistes invités venant du monde entier et les quelques 40 000 festivaliers attendus. Toutes les cultures du monde seront de la fête en Terres de Saône cet été !

Réservation auprès de l'office de Tourisme Terres de Saône, 73 rue François Mitterrand, à Port-sur-Saône (03.84.78.10.66) ou directement sur le site internet www.festivalportsursaone.com

name: Romolo Folk Fest - Santa Teresa di Riva
description:
The event takes place in Santa Teresa di Riva in the province of Messina, a prominent location for the
Ionian Coast which enjoys the proximity of Taormina and Castelmola, easily reachable both from Catania
than from Messina. A great feast of sounds and colors in Santa Teresa di Riva, in which the culture narrates the identity and roots of people: "Romolo Folk Fest".
The main reason of the festival is to remember and honor the main exponent in the folkloric field of the Ionian Coast, or Melino Romolo, founder and historic president of the group "Canterini della Riviera Jonica" of Roccalumera that today, after his death, bear his name. Romolo Folk Fest is divided into two distinct moments:
-The concert "Il Sud che Balla" 
-International Folklore Festival, born with the aim of promoting and encouraging the meeting, the
mutual knowledge and the brotherhood of peoples, helping to enhance and safeguard traditions and
the various ethnic groups through cultural exchange.

address: Solar do Capitão-Mor, 1º - Horta das Figuras
name: FOLKFARO - FOLCLORE INTERNACIONAL CIDADE DE FARO
description:
The unique CIOFF® recognized festival in south Portugal, FOLKFARO, takes place in Faro (Portugal) and surrounding area of the city, in the second half of August. 

Faro is the capital of Algarve - the beautiful sunny region of southern Portugal, renown worldwide for its pleasant climate, beaches outlined in rocks shaped by the sea and immense stretches of golden sand. 

This international event is looking to promote and share the folklore and traditions of different nations to strengthen the friendship and the identity of each country. It includes a large variety of activities: gala show in theatre, open-air performances, international parades, children and elderly programmes, dance workshops, etc. 

During 9 days, groups from 7 countries, in a total of more than 300 participants, paint the Algarve region with their colours of their traditions.
The event organization is in charge of "Grupo Folclórico de Faro" (Faro Folk Dance Group) supported by the Town Hall of Faro and other public institutions of Algarve Region, and also with the sponsorship of local companies. 

Official Website: www.folkfaro.com
location: Teatro das Figuras / Passeio da Doca

name: Festival Internazionale del Folklore 'Incontro di Cultura Popolare' - Macerata
description:
Since 1993, the first edition of the International Folklore Festival - Meeting of Popular Culture, the folkloristic festival of the city of Macerata has acquired more and more importance every year at regional, national and international level, thanks to the support of the various municipal administrations and to all members of the present, of the past and the future of the organizing group "Li Pistacoppi". 
Macerata is a charming town, one of the capitals of the Marche region, known for its marked propensity and interest in the cultural sphere in all its aspects, for this reason the most important day of the Festival has as its location, the impressive Arena Sferisterio, known worldwide for the Opera Lirica, which however in recent years has also acquired a value, in some respects, more popular and close to the people, offering at the same time a high-level show in a magnificent setting. 
Due to its itinerant nature, the festival every evening brings the participating delegations to know a different location, from the Macerata inland to the Marche coast. All with the intention of letting our guests know about our territory, as well as presenting the different cultures of the groups participating in an ever-wider indigenous audience.
The beginning is fixed for August 17th and the final date is that of 23rd. As already mentioned, the main event, usually on August 20th, takes place in the Arena Sferisterio, while another event to mention is that that since some years now has been taking place in one of the city's squares which for the occasion hosts the “Party in the square” with all the citizens and members of the invited groups who have the opportunity to socialize in first person through the typical dances and songs, without that distance fictitious that a stage can represent. 
On Sunday the traditional Eucharistic ceremony takes place, with the participation of all the groups in costume that animate the solemn Mass, singing their traditional religious hymns. With this ritual we intend to emphasize the unity of peoples that our festival has always sought: although our religion may be different, we all gather in faith. 
In conclusion, a festival in which the different cultures of the groups and participants come into contact with our traditions, in a sort of exchange, precisely a MEETING OF POPULAR CULTURE.

name: Internationales Schlitzerländer Trachtenfest
description:
" Die Welt trifft sich bei Freunden"

Alle zwei Jahre, jeweils am zweiten Wochenende im Juli, herrscht Ausnahmezustand im Schlitzerland. Die kleine osthessische Region taucht für einigeTage in buntes Treiben mit internationalem Flair. Folklore und moderne Klänge,Trachten und Jeans – nirgends treffen Gegensätze so harmonisch aufeinander.

Musik, Tanz, Party, internationale Folklore, Festzug, Feuerwerk und am Ende eine gigantische Polonäse durch die Altstadt – feiern Sie mit uns das Trachtenfest in Schlitz. 

Every two years at the second weekend of July the whole Schlitzerland is going crazy. The small region in the middle of Germany will celebrate from Friday, 7th July till Monday, 10th July 2017, the so called Trachtenfest. It's an international music- and folklorefestival with artists from all over the world.
Music, dancing, party, international folklore, historical parade, fireworks and at the end a giant conga line through the medieval oldtown - join the party the Trachtenfest in Schlitz!Folklore and modern sounds, traditional costumes and jeans – no where else opposites clash so harmonically.

FOLK CANTANHEDE - SEMANA INTERNACIONAL DE FOLCLORE
description:
FOLK Cantanhede - Semana Internacional de Folclore is a metting of cultures from all over the world where folklore and cultural identity are promoted as an important factor of human valorization and social balance.
FOLK Cantanhede began in 2006 where more than 90 groups have participated.

name: INTERETNO FESTIVAL - SUBOTICA
description:
INTERETNO FESTIVAL
SUBOTICA

The Subotica-based Népkör Hungarian Cultural Centre is the oldest, continuously operating cultural organisation in Vojvodina. It was established on 15 October 1871. At present, Népkör has about 700 members active in the following groups: folklore group (folk dance, folk music and folk songs), Sándor Oláh Painting Group, school of drawing, decorating art group, drama group for children and adults and the Aranykapu (Golden Gate) Playhouse. Owing to its versatile and high quality activities, Népkör was awarded the Pro Urbe Award in 2002, which is the highest social award in the city of Subotica, while in 2011 the center was granted the For Minrities Award by the Prime Minister of Hungary. Népkör has been the proud guardian of traditions for 145 years.

Népkör Hungarian Cultural Center (Subotica), Summerfest from Százhalombatta and the local government of Subotica have jointly been organizing Interetno Festival each year in August since 2002. Culture, tradition, cultural values. These are the three core concepts of this festival, which is one of the largest traditional events in the Vojvodina Province. From the beginnings, the ever evolving festival tries to emphasize the importance of folklore and folk art through dance groups and bands who perform folk music and folk dance at very high standards. 

Subotica is placed in Serbia, in the north of the Autonomous Province of Vojvodina, in the Northern Backa District. Subotica, the city with seven gates can also be called a Little Europe. The city where more than one culture prevails, the city where several ethnic groups live their everyday lives simultaneously. It is the capital of Art Nouveau,  also the largest village in Europe and the home of 150 thousand inhabitants. Subotica is a strange place. Those who visit the city yearn to come back, because the things they can see, feel and experience here serve as a valuable memory they carry on into the world. There is no other city which could show the spirit of Interetno Festival better than Subotica, as it creates the values of the modern world, understanding and solidarity. The 76 meter high Town Hall each year proudly proclaims that the world comes to Subotica.

name: International Folklore Festival Cantecele Muntilor
description:
„Songs of the Mountains” International Folklore Festival

Sibiu, the residence town of Sibiu county, situated at the foot of Cibin Mountains, with a population of over 150.000 residents, a strong economic, scientific, cultural and tourist centre is the host of  THE INTERNATIONAL FOLKLORE  FESTIVAL „CÂNTECELE MUNTILOR” / “SONGS OF MONTAINS”, the 49th edition, 7th -12th August 2024.	
The festival turns into account the traditions of various communities, from Romania and abroad, and acknowledges unity in the spirit of cultural diversity. The festival invites people of all age and social status to enjoy folklore, to take part in manifestations that preserve and promote traditional culture. 
Among the events of the festival we name: folk shows, performances, dance workshops, culinary art evenings etc.
The „Songs of the Mountains” International Folk Festival gained notoriousness among folklore friends and a special place in the hearts of the Sibiu inhabitants. Within the context of the European integration, the festival contributes to the promotion of Romanian and foreign communitie’s traditions, approaching unity in the spirit of cultural diversity.

description:
International Folklore Festival “DOINA COVURLUIULUI"
Galati – Romania

International Folklore Festival “DOINA COVURLUIULUI" 
Galati – Romania
 
Every year since 2006, the "Dunarea de Jos" Cultural Center of Galati, Romania, held 
the International Folklore Festival "Doina Covurluiului". The 15th edition of the festival is 
scheduled for 20th-25th of August, 2020. 
Since its first edition, the festival was attended by hundreds of artists from over 30 countries 
in Europe, Asia, Africa and America. Thus, the people of Galati County had the opportunity 
to witness the traditions of many nations of the world. 
Each year, the "Dunarea de Jos" Cultural Center of Galati is also the organizer of an 
international folklore festival for children ("Ca la noi in Covurlui"), thus the International 
Folklore Festival "Doina Covurluiului" is open to young and adult artists only (over 16 
years old). 
The festival is a CIOFF registered member, and its organizers fully comply with the 
recommendations of the aforementioned international forum. 

Festival director, 
Ion Chiciuc – Headmaster of “Doina Covurluiului” Folk Ensemble

name: Võru Folklore Festival
description:
Since 1994 every year in July hundreds of dancers, musicians and singers from Estonia and all over the world come together in Võru and give us a chance to experience the folklore of different countries.
 Colourful concerts and dance parties, accordion playing competition, workshops, street dancing, songs about the eve on the beach of lake Tamula, concerts of young folk musicians, midnight movies, art and handicraft fair – all of this makes up the Võru Folklore Festival.
 Our mission is to promote folk dancing and the culture of folkdance festivals in Estonia and as the biggest folkdance festival in southern Estonia to carry on the tradition of folk dancing. We also aim to vivify everything that carries on the old traditions of our town, county and historical Võru region. Võru Folklore Festival has a big part in keeping alive the tradition of Estonian Song Festival that belongs to the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity List.

name: International CIOFF® Folklore Festival 'Kyparissia Sunshine'
description: The International CIOFF® Festival “Kyparissia Sunshine”, has become an integral part of the cultural history of our town, Kyparissia, our Municipality & our Region. Every year music & dance Ensembles from 5 countries of the five continents display their own style and present a part of their tradition and cultural heritage to us. At the same time, they have the opportunity to feel and see close up our own style, our everyday life, our habits, our hospitality and our manner of safeguarding and promoting culture through the performances as well as through cultural events with the title : "Feeling our cultural heritage", concerning Mediterranean diet, our local cuisine & costumes, our region through time, traditional games, practices, visits to museums & archaeological sites, (Ancient Olympia & Peristeria Mycenaean tombs ), workshops. The International CIOFF® Festival, “Kyparissia Sunshine” is one of the most significant cultural events in our town, our Municipality & our Region for 16 years now and it is organized by the Educational & cultural Society of Kyparissia, (M.E.S.K.) with the financial support of our Municipality, the Municipality of Trifylia.
location: Educational and Cultural Association of Kyparissi

name: Festivalul International de Folclor 'Muzici si Traditii in Bucuresti'
description:
The International Folklore Festival "Music and Traditions in Bucharest" (13 editions) is the only international folklore festival in Bucharest and in the south-eastern area of Romania, organized annually by CREART – Center for Creation, Art and Tradition of the Bucharest Municipality.
Every year, the festival brings authentic tradition to the urban area through music, dance and folk art, promoting the beauty and uniqueness of each nation in the context of globalization and the preservation of social and cultural identity. Through this event, the identity of the village is reproduced in the urban space, and the authentic tradition is integrated into the great European cultural circuit.
The event brings together a parade of traditional costumes, music and dance performances from the authentic folklore, craftmen fair and local products, an area dedicated to the reinterpreted folklore, creative workshops, gastronomic areas.
In its 13 years of existence, the cultural program has enjoyed the participation of music and dance ensembles from 32 countries, 25,000 national and international artists, 870 artisans, craftsmen and plastic artists from Romania and an audience of 320,000 spectators. www.creart.ro

name: II FIFAT- Festival Internacional de Folclore e Artes Tradicionais do Centro Oeste
description:
The MATO GROSSO Folklore Festival (FIFAT-MT) is a proposal aimed at important dynamic expansions that encompass conceptual crossings, densification and horizontalization of processes, programs and projects of the regional cultural and tourism sector, observing and contributing to the aspects of educational training, dissemination of regional cultural production in its various languages, in addition to the promotion of artists, groups and collectives that articulate within the professional sphere of cultural and tourist production. In order to serve part of this production chain, FIFAT aims to strengthen, through a festival, the culture of relations between the public administration, regional cultural and tourist agents, promoting parallel articulations in the sense of encouraging the proposal of new actions that contributed to the formation of a fertile panorama that contributes to the sustainable development of the region. The action will have a total duration of 08 days, with all its free actions and its age group distinguished according to each activity."

name: 'VRŠACKI VENAC' -Vršac
description:
International folk festival “The Wreath of Vršac”

The International Folk Festival “The Wreath of Vršac” began in 1993, with the intention to, like many famous world festivals, preserve and cherish the most valuable things in the rich history of folk songs and dances. In essence, this folk review has the intention to present the best achievements of the international folk scene to the expert critics, as well as to the wide audience. From the very beginning, the International Folk Festival “The Wreath of Vršac” has been following the defined programme conception. The artistic stylization of the stage folklore, as a kind of addition to the original folk structure, is performed at the Festival on stage by numerous amateur ensembles and is a special challenge for all the people who cherish traditional values of their nations through music and dance. 
During the Festival, the review and accompanying programme offer a number of interesting events, such as: concerts, exhibitions, ethnology lectures, ethno fair, learning of traditional Serbian dances. Almost 500 ensembles from the whole world participated at the nineteen previous Festivals.The scientific meetings during the festivals have brought together more than fifty most eminent ethnologists, ethnomusicologists and choreographers from Serbia and from abroad. 
The festival is held annually the second week of July.

name: Festidanses du monde
description:
Le "Festidanses du monde"  est né en 1979 de la volonté du groupe folklorique « Lous Cigalouns de Mourseuns », en partenariat avec le Comité des Fêtes et le soutien de la Ville de Morcenx.

Depuis sa création en 1946, le groupe « Lous Cigalouns » a représenté Morcenx et les Landes sur les scènes des plus grands Festivals Nationaux (Confolens, Dijon, Gannat, Saintes, Rochefort, Montoire, etc..) et internationaux (Etats-Unis, Angleterre, Hollande, Autriche, Suisse, Côte d’Ivoire, Algérie, Allemagne, Yougoslavie, Belgique, Portugal, Espagne, Italie, Hongrie, Mexique).

De leurs longs voyages à travers le monde, ils ont ramené de merveilleux souvenirs et l’envie de faire partager à leurs concitoyens le plaisir de découvrir des Cultures, des modes de vie, des traditions souvent très éloignées des nôtres. Cela a été dès le début un des buts principaux des organisateurs du Festival.

De très nombreux liens d’amitié se sont ainsi créés au fil des années et des spectacles, de la scène du Gymnase à celle de la salle du Maroc, entre la population locale et les membres de la soixantaine de groupes venus de plus de trente Nations, reçus à Morcenx au cours des éditions successives.

Biennale Folklorique à ses origines, car se déroulant tous les deux ans (les années impaires) le troisième week-end de Juillet, le Festival a pris en 1997 le nom de Festival Folklorique de la Haute Lande.

Après des débuts modestes, le Festival a peu à peu établi sa notoriété et s’impose désormais comme un des moments forts de l’animation en Pays Morcenais.

name: Festival Internacional del Folklor Universitario Tamaulipas
description: El Festival Internacional del Folklor Universitario Tamaulipas es un evento dancístico en el cual se pretende reunir un sin fin de artistas entre bailarines y músicos así como expositores y artesanos de México y del extranjero, con la finalidad de apreciar lo más selecto en cuanto al folklor  de su lugar de origen, llevándose a cabo muestras de danza folklórica en teatros así como en escenarios al aire libre , donde también se podrá apreciar la gran riqueza artesanal así como la extensa gastronomía de los grupos nacionales y extranjeros, permitiendo con esto, rescatar y difundir el folklor de los pueblos del mundo, que unidos a través de la música y la danza preservan sus costumbres y tradiciones.

name: International Folklore Festival CIOFF 'Pilsen'
description:
Since 1997 is the International Folklore Festival CIOFF® Pilsen the meeting place for lovers of folklore and traditional folk art. Each year about 20 groups of adults or children from the Czech Republic and foreign countries – including some exotic places like Egypt, Mexico, Ecuador or Zimbabwe – take part in this festival.

Each festival event takes place in the historical centre of Pilsen in the pleasant surroundings of the Smetana Garden (the main festival scene "U Branky"). Hundreds of participants in fancy traditional costumes create an unforgettable atmosphere through their dances and music for which the festival events are regularly visited by large number of excited fans. Since 2006 the part of the festival is also the live recording of the Czech Radio Pilsen.

The Dýšina Folklore Festivities took place in the years 2001–2003 in small village Dýšina and in the years 2001 and 2002 also the International Folklore Afternoon in Horní Bríza. Currently there are also the Small Folklore Festivities Under the Vrcen Lime Tree in the pleasant surroundings of village Vrcen Vrcen (from 2004) and also the Folklore Evening in the village Cižice (from 2007). Some selected groups are also participating in the program of the Historical Weekend held by the Foundation of 700 Years of the City of Pilsen.

Moreover, a part of the festival is also the parade through Pilsen and a traditional Czech fair, exhibits of traditional craft production and gastronomy, an art competition for children Folklore Traditions in the Eyes of Children and a number of accompanying programmes (educational performances of foreign folklore for school children, concerts for the elderly, a folklore programme at the ZOO, presentation of regional winners of the Young Singer competition ("Zpevácek"), brass bands performances etc.)

Currently the main organizer of the festival is the Pilsen Folklore Scene (Plzenská folklorní scéna, z.s.) working in cooperation with the City of Pilsen, the Pilsen Region, the Foundation of 700 Years of The City of Pilsen, the Ministry of Culture, The Folklore Association of the Czech Republic, the Jiskra Folklore Ensemble, the Czech Radio Pilsen and a number of other partners.

Since 2008 the festival is a regular member of the prestigious worldwide organization CIOFF® which works within the scope of UNESCO organization.

name: FESTIVAL INTERGENERACIONAL DE DANZA FOLKLÓRICA
description:
Como una muestra de unidad y de convivencia a través de la danza de proyección folklórica, el Instituto Nacional de Pensiones para Empleados Públicos (INPEP) en coordinación con el Ballet Folklórico "Caña de Azúcar" y el respaldo de CIOFF El Salvador, realizan la Muestra Intergeneracional de Danza Folklórica, el cuál nace en febrero de 2012.  

Esta muestra intergeneracional, como su nombre lo indica, une en un escenario a tres generaciones: niñez, juventud y adultos mayores, quienes compartiendo e interactuando en una misma obra danzaria, dan a conocer que el folklore, en todos sus ámbitos, es una expresión artística sin tiempo ni edad.

La Muestra Intergeneracinal de Danza Folklórica, ha sido acreditada como Festival Nacional por el Concejo Internacional de Organizaciones de Festivales de Folklore y de las Artes Tradicionales (CIOFF), Sección Nacional El Salvador.

name: 'Butinle in Stajare'-Incontro della cultura popolare europea - Buja
description:
At the end of July of every year, the annual meeting of the international folklore meeting called ‘Butinle in Stajare 2019 - Meeting of European popular culture’ will take place in Buja (Ud). The Festival has obtained the advocacy by the Municipality of Buja, by the ‘Hills Community’ of Friuli and by the regional administration of Friuli Venezia Giulia. We recall that the birth of this event took place back in 1981, although in another form. Today's demonstration, resumed in 2007 after several years of suspension, is becoming increasingly important over the years, for our municipality and for those towns layed along the hills of the region, and the population looks forward to the presentation of the program every year, and above all waits to know the groups that the ‘Balarins’ will go to present. The groups, taking part into this event, are not part of any circuit, and are guests of the city of Buja and only here they perform to the public. This is acharacteristic of this event, which wants to be first of all a moment of encounter and exchange of European cultures of different character, meeting of people and interweaving of friendship relations between groups and people, not only showing the public music and dances from every part of Europe, but creating bridges and dialogues between people of culture, thought, religion, principles different from each other: this spirit of personal friendship pervades the evenings of the festival.
The cooperation with Cioff ® Italia gave us new possibilities for welcoming groups from various areas of Europe.
We want this occasion to become a central point of our activity, we want to bring to Buja from year to year, the groups known in the tours around Europe, which with us have had and have special cooperation and friendship relationships. We want to bring musicality and cultural experiences from all over Europe to Buja, making known uses, languages, traditions, of different countries for history, culture and folklore.
The event is usually held with a series of related activities and the program includes: an official reception of the participating groups and a visit to the museum of the medal and the city of Buja, and the presentation through a press conference of the event, the main evening of the event to be held at Piazza S. Stefano in front of the Municipality of Buja, moments of acquaintance and interaction between the groups to establish mutual relations of knowledge and integration; groups are usually invite to visit some places in our region, arriving in Ravascletto, on our wonderful mountains, where it will be held the final day of the event.

name: 'LICIDERSKO SRCE' International childrens folklore festival- UŽICE
description: International Children's Folklore Festival "Licidersko srce" was organized seventh times in Serbia. So far,  about  5,000 children from Serbia and 30 other countries have participated in the festival. It is often  held during the third week of  August.  in Uzice and very popular touristic destinations in Western Serbia and Bosnia and Hercegovina. The organizer of this manifestation is NGO "ERA" from town Uzice. Besides children from Serbia, participants are also children and  groups from all over the world. There are usually 10 foreign ensembles and about 20 groups  from Serbia. It's  about 900 children (10 to 16 years age) that participate in the festival every year. From the very beginning, the  festival is supported by the Ministry of Culture and the Ministry of Education of the Republic of Serbia. Due to the importance and the influence that the festival has in the expansion of friendly relations among nations  and countries, the patron of the festival is the president of the Republic of Serbia. The main goals of the festival are: the promotion of  cultural cooperation of  children community, the strengthening the friendly connections  between the countries, and fostering multiculturalism and multi-ethnicity. Besides folklor concerts, parades and street animations, there are many interesting activities during all five festival days. Some of them are: the exibition of national costumes of the participating countries, folklore workshops, international seminar for choreographers and folklor teachers, humanitarian action, touristic visits, concerts of popular singers (artists), poterry workshop...The media partner is National TV - RTS, and festival has very big media attention.

name: INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS’ FOLKLORE FESTIVAL -Niš
description:
INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS’ FOLKLORE FESTIVAL
NIŠ  - SERBIA

International Students’ Folklore Festival- City ofNiš (Serbia) takes place every year from 2008, in midst of July, from 16-20th.
Organizer and founder of the Festival is Students’ Cultural Center Niš and its Academic Folklore Ensemble ORO. 
Festival is under patronage of Ministry of Education of Republic of Serbia, City of Niš and City Municipalities. 
From it’s beginning,Festival is organized according to Regulations of CIOFF.
Our Festival has been recognized as a CIOFF International Festival, as the highest rang for organizing folk festival, at Congress at Budapest (Hungary) on November 9th 2021.
Our intention is to introduce folklore traditions and diverse national cultures to citizens of Niš and southeast Serbia through Festival, and to present our large cultural heritage as well. 
Every year, 6-8 students’ ensembles from different countries take part. 
Maximum number of participants (including orchestra and drivers) is 35 persons. 
Costs of transportation within Serbia, accommodation and meals are to be submitted by organizer. 
Accommodation and meals will be provided in the students dormitories in Niš, in two-bed rooms (each room has bathroom), at the expense of the organizer.
Transportation costs outside Serbia are to be submitted by participating ensemble. 
If some group came to Serbia by plane, Organizing Committee will provide bus transportation with covered expenses from the airport (Belgrade) to Niš (250 km).
Performances of the ensembles will take place in Niš, and surrounding towns (Bela Palanka, Ražanj, Knjaževac, Soko Banja and Vladicin Han), up to 20-30 minutes per performance. 
Opening ceremony and concert in Niš will be on July 16th. 
Final performance of all participants will take place in Niš on July 20th, on open air stage in the City Fortress. 
For the opening concert and final concert, each Ensemble should prepare a performance up to 15 minutes. Also, before opening and final concert, street parade is planned.
Ensembles are due to perform with live music (orchestra). 
Application deadline is January 31st. Together with Application Form, applicants must enclose CV of ensemble, link for video where we can seeperformance of the group, and at least two photos in optimal resolution which are to be used for propaganda material of the Festival. 
Applicants will be noticed about their applications until February 15th.
